title: Drawing, "Frieze (preparatory drawing for pl. 6 "Cahier II de Poeles, Piedestaux, Atheniennes et Frises."", 1775–80
medium:
Pen and black ink, traces of black chalk
Support: white laid paper laid down on white laid paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink, in escutcheon, (according to Rudolf Berliner, by Delafosse's hand): inv. f /j. CH. / Delafosse; in pen and brown ink, at bottom margin of mount: J. ch. Delafosse Ex Musaeo C.N. Varin / frise
provenance: C.N. Varin (?); Léon Decloux (acquired by Decloux after l906)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The right half is shown; rinceaux flanking the central motif, of which half is an escutcheon; a crouching lion biting a snake which in turn bites a child, forms a part of a trophy of arms.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Frieze (preparatory drawing for pl. 6 "Cahier II de Poeles, Piedestaux, Atheniennes et Frises."", 1775–80. Pen and black ink, traces of black chalk
Support: white laid paper laid down on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-46.
